



Sankey plot
```{r}
nodes = data.frame(name= estrogen_names,
                   group = c("A","A","B","B","B","C","C","C","C","C","D","D","D","D","D"   ))
nodes$id = seq(0,nrow(nodes)-1)

links = data.frame(from = c(          0,0,0,0,             1,1,1,           5,5,5,7,8,               2,3,        10,10,12,13      ),
                   to   = c(     2,5,10,14,               4,7,2,            6,7,8,9,9,              3,4,        11,12,13,14    ),
                   color = c(    "B","C","D","D",       "B","C","B",     "C","C","C","C","C",       "B","B",    "D","D","D","D"     ),
                   thickness = c(   0.01,0.38,0.38,0.48,   0.24,0.3,0.11,   0.37,0.33,0.31,0.38,0.48,  0.1,0.61,   0.32,0.44,0.5,0.62  )
)


my_color <- 'd3.scaleOrdinal() .domain(["A", "B","C","D"]) .range(["lightblue", "wheat","lightgreen","lightpink"])'


sankeyNetwork(Links = links, Nodes = nodes, Source = "from",
              Target = "to", Value = "thickness", NodeID = "name",
              iterations=80,fontSize = 20,nodeWidth = 20, nodePadding = 100,fontFamily = "arial",height = 1000,width = 1000, sinksRight = FALSE,
              NodeGroup = "group",LinkGroup="color",colourScale = my_color)
```
